abstract.p: Teams from Bronx, Pequannock, NJ, and Lyme/Old Lyme, Conn, qualify for quarterfinals in East Regional Little League tournament in Bristol, Conn (S)

block.p: Teams from the Bronx, Pequannock, N.J., and Lyme/Old Lyme, Conn., qualified for today's quarterfinals in the East Regional Little League tournament in Bristol, Conn. The winner of Thursday night's regional final will advance to the Little League World Series in Williamsport, Pa., from Aug. 20 to 26.

The Bronx team is seeded first in the Middle Atlantic bracket and will face Delaware this afternoon. The New Jersey team, which is seeded second, meets the District of Columbia today. The team from Pequannock won its last round-robin game yesterday, beating Maryland, 4-1.

Teams from the Bronx, Pequannock, N.J., and Lyme/Old Lyme, Conn., qualified for today's quarterfinals in the East Regional Little League tournament in Bristol, Conn. The winner of Thursday night's regional final will advance to the Little League World Series in Williamsport, Pa., from Aug. 20 to 26.

The Bronx team is seeded first in the Middle Atlantic bracket and will face Delaware this afternoon. The New Jersey team, which is seeded second, meets the District of Columbia today. The team from Pequannock won its last round-robin game yesterday, beating Maryland, 4-1.
Connecticut, which is seeded second behind New Hampshire in the Northeast bracket, plays Massachusetts in the quarterfinals. Connecticut beat Maryland, 16-6, yesterday.
